result.execSummary:
The defendant Byron K. Lee Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Byron K. Lee Sr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Byron K. Lee Sr. was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees.**
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.**
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.**
**Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. **
May not have contact with Susan Lee.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination f the DE's probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Byron K. Lee Sr.

records.addlTxt:
9:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Byron K. Lee Sr. in court. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM1068/22CM1132. Victim rights compliance. Victim appears in court today. DE does not want an attorney and would like to proceed pro see. Court will allow the DE and ADA Huber to discuss resolution off the record. DE waives his right to an attorney. Matter is resolved and agreement placed on the record.

22CM1068: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 2; found guilty by the court. On the State's motion, count 1 is dismissed. Sentencing arguments heard. Victim addresses the Court. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions. No contact with S.L..  Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. 5 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs, DV surcharge and DNA surcharge ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the cost; written notice provided to defendant.

22CM1132: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 2; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, counts 1 & 3 are dismissed. Sentencing arguments heard. Victim addresses the Court. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions. No contact with S.L..  Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. 5 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs, DV surcharge and DNA surcharge ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the cost; written notice provided to defendant in 22CM1068.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Susan E. L, ASL,  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's Susan L residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

149-156PM   Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Zachary Caley.  Clerk: P. U. Victim SL made statement in court.  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today. Not Guilty plea entered.  Defendant referred to SPD.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:45 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:30 am. $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  sg
and witness list filed by the State
